data.question: What is the chemical formula for the oxalate-bridged bimetallic complexes discussed in the study?
What property do the {NH(prol)3}[MCr(ox)3] complexes exhibit under 40% relative humidity?
data.answer: Proton conduction of 1.2 × 10−10 to 4.4 × 10−10 S cm−1

data.question: What is the transition temperature for ferromagnetic ordering in the MnCr complex?
How does the interlayer magnetic interaction in the MnCr complex compare to its short interlayer separation?
data.answer: The interlayer magnetic interaction is negligibly weak despite the short interlayer separation.

data.question: Is the synthesis of {NH(prol)3}[MCr(ox)3] complexes successful in aqueous solution?
What method is used for the crystal structure determination of {NH(prol)3}[MnCr(ox)3]·2H2O?
What is the role of NH(prol)3+ ions in the structure of the complexes?
data.answer: They assume a tripodal configuration and are hydrogen bonded to the bimetallic layers.

data.question: Do the complexes exhibit ferromagnetism and proton conduction simultaneously?
What is the proton conductivity of the complexes under 75% relative humidity?
Are the complexes sensitive to moisture?
What is the significance of water molecules in the proton conduction of the complexes?
data.answer: Water molecules are involved in the hydrogen-bonded network responsible for proton conduction.

data.question: Do the complexes decompose under high relative humidity?
What is the coercive field of the MnCr complex at 2 K?
How does the magnetization of the MnCr complex at 2 K compare to the expected value?
data.answer: The magnetization is smaller than the expected value, indicating spin canting.

data.question: Is the synthesis of {NH(prol)3}[MCr(ox)3] complexes more successful in organic solvents?
What is the interlayer separation in the MnCr complex?
Does the unsymmetrical feature of the bimetallic layer affect the magnetization behavior?
What is the role of additional water molecules in proton conduction under high RH?
data.answer: They contribute to the high proton conduction by being more mobile than water molecules bound to the lattice.

data.question: Are the complexes the first example of a metal complex system exhibiting coexistent ferromagnetism and high proton conduction?
What is the proposed mechanism for proton conduction in the complexes?
data.answer: The mechanism is not definitively determined and requires further study.
